Sentencas: Metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells (MS-SOECs) are being developed for steam-tohydrogen electrolysis, especially for utilization of dynamic or intermittent electrical power from renewable sources.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: Various aspects of the electrocatalyst processing and composition, and metal support structure were explored.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: Catalyst materials, infiltration temperature and infiltration cycles were optimized for high performance and durability.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: Numerous catalyst materials were screened for both oxygen and steam electrodes.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: The oxygen catalyst had moderate impact on both initial cell performance and durability.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: Reducing Ni content in the steam electrode had little effect on durability, but reduced initial performance.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: Ex-situ XRD analysis and cell assessment of catalyst infiltration temperature revealed that the optimal range is 750-850 & DEG;C. The best cell performance and durability was achieved with LSCF-SDC oxygen electrocatalyst and SDC-Ni (60:40 vol%) steam electrocatalyst infiltrated 11 times at 800 & DEG;C and operated at 700 & DEG;C. At low steam content, a significant mass transport limitation on the steam side results in limiting current behavior.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts

Sentencas: Thinner and more porous metal supports were implemented, and found to improve steam mass transport at low steam content, relevant for SOECs operating under high H2 recycle rate or high steam utilization.& COPY; 2023 Hydrogen Energy Publications LLC.
Titulo: Optimization of metal-supported solid oxide electrolysis cells with infiltrated catalysts
